title: World Cosplay Summit
rules:
WCS specific rules

The World Cosplay Summit constitutes the Cosplay Parade, the Cosplay Championship, and other related promotional activities.

Rules on Participation in the Cosplay Summit

  • For cosplay weapons guidelines the house rules of the Dutch weapons law will always apply!
  • The Dutch team will be represented by one team of two cosplayers.
  • The team must be in costumes from the same series.
  • The costumes must be from Japanese anime, manga or video games. (Shueisha titles i.e. Bleach, One Piece, Naruto, etc. may not be used).
  • Cosplay costumes and major props are to be hand-made. Pre-/ready-made costumes are not allowed.
  • You must be able to come to Japan from the end of July to the beginning of August for the World Cosplay Summit.
  • You should be aged 18 or over on the date of the preliminaries.
  • You should cooperate in a positive manner in order to ensure the success of the World Cosplay Summit.
  • A valid passport must be presented at AnimeCon.
  • If you have won the preliminaries at AnimeCon 2019, your team cannot compete for the honour to represent The Netherlands this time.
  • If your team places second and one member of the winning team cannot go, you are not eligible to replace that team.
  • A replacement will be chosen by the original team members, WCS Inc. and Stichting J-Pop.
  • Your flight will be paid for by Stichting Japanse Popcultuur, the rest of your costs (food, drink, trips, extra luggage etc.) will NOT be covered.
  • The team must perform an act on stage that may not exceed 150 seconds.
  • Once entered, you will get a script form to fill in the details of your act. This will have to be handed in on May 20th, 23:59h at the latest.
  • With your script, you will also have to provide:
    - Work in Progress pictures from all parts of the costume and relevant props,
    - Reference pictures,
    - Any audio/video you want to use during the skit.
  • 3D-printing: Somewhere on the final product needs to be an embossment of your makers mark (your initials) as part of the design. Make screenshots during the designing to add to your WiPs.
  • Teams may not use: Any items that can spill on the stage, like bubbles, glitter, confetti etc.
  • Teams may not use: Live fire, dry ice, live steel weapons or other things that could be a danger to yourself or others
  • You may not perform an act already done in a previous year at Animecon, it needs to be a new performance.
  • In the case of cancelling your  participation in this competition within two weeks of AnimeCon, without a legitimate reason, you will not be able to sign up again for one year.

Preparation: Rules and Warnings

  • You are required to bring three costumes to Japan: one for the parade, one for the championship, and one for media appearances. (If you absolutely can't, two will suffice)
  • In the Cosplay Championship, please make sure the costumes of the characters in which both of you will appear are from the same Japanese manga or anime or video game
  • Equipment and props for the Cosplay Championship performance are limited to those of a size that 2 representative cosplayers and 1 organiser are able to carry on their own at one time to the venue. Only 3 people are able to prepare the performance backstage.
  • Props may not be larger than 2 meter and may not be heavier than 20kg.
  • You are required to bear the cost of any overweight luggage charges when shipping costumes and other items.
  • Please make sure you have enough making-of pictures of your costume, preferably with you in them too, so we can be sure it's your work.
  • Please prepare your own music for your performance. A performance sheet stating what you will perform is to be submitted in advance, you may not use the original voice actors' voice for the music in Japan.
  • Please join the Facebook group of WCS Team Netherlands

Other Regulations for the Championship

  • The performance at the Championship can be the same as the performance given in the preliminary round, but if it is the same, you should try to improve upon it for the championship.
  • Please strictly adhere to the time limit of 150 seconds. This includes the setting up of any equipment/props on stage up to the end of the performance. If the performance is too long, points will be deducted.
  • Only the 2 representative cosplayers, an organiser, and an interpreter are permitted to enter the backstage area of the Championship.
  • The organiser and WCS staff or any other person is not permitted to help you during your performance on stage (2 members of stage staff will help you to set up your equipment/props on stage).
  • It is possible to scatter things on stage during your performance, but staining, marking or damaging the stage in any way is prohibited. Anything that takes time to clean up on stage is also not allowed.
  • It is prohibited to take your performance into the audience area.
  • Using fire is prohibited.
  • The order of performances is decided by a draw after your arrival in Japan.

Judging Criteria for the Championship

The judging process for WCS consists of two separate judgings:

Part 1:

All organisers, except those of your country, will judge craftsmanship. Everything will be judged according to your reference material. Make sure you have a copy in your Cosplay Book. Using too many rhinestones on plane fabric (according to reference) will deduct points from your score! 

Please do note that everything from quality of sewing, gluing and material and colour use will be judged. Props you do not hold in your hands, will not be judged. The total for this judging comes to 33.3% of your total score! 

Part 2:

Stage performance judgement by celebs and other people. This will be 66.6% of your total score. Here the level of performance, inventiveness, entertainment will be judged, as well as how the costume looks on stage (design, faithfulness to the original characters costume) and finally the fidelity to Original characters will be judged (Does Asuka really swill whisky?).
description: For the last several  years, AnimeCon has been invited to join the fun in the World Championships of Cosplay, the World Cosplay Summit (WCS) in Nagoya, Japan! This means that during our regular Cosplay Competition, the best team (according to WCS judgment rules) of two Cosplayers will be chosen to represent The Netherlands as official Dutch entrants for the competition in Japan!
webDescription:
Stichting Promotie Japanse Popcultuur, the people behind AnimeCon, will send both winners and an AnimeCon staff member to Japan from end of July to early August 2024 to represent our country at this great international competition!

The free and dynamic nature of manga was instrumental in the birth of cosplay. Nowadays youth from around the world find this as a common language and a dynamic new form of global interaction. The World Cosplay Summit began in Osu, Nagoya and has grown to include 36 countries from around the world. If you count audience and participants at each preliminary event, the number of people involved is now in the 100s of thousands.

What is the World Cosplay Championship?

The WCS is a cosplay event organised by WCS Inc. It stands for the World Cosplay Summit and began back in 2005. It's designed to determine a Grand Champion through stage performances by representative teams from each participating country. The championship is graded on the finish of the costume design and the team’s performance on stage. Grand Champions from previous years are as follows:

2005: Italy
2006: Brazil
2007: France
2008: Brazil
2009: Japan
2010: Italy
2011: Brazil
2012: Japan
2013: Italy
2014: Russia
2015: Mexico
2016: Indonesia
2017: China
2018: Mexico
2019: Australia
2021: Germany
2022: France (stage division) and Sweden (video division)

2023: We wish the Metamorphe Sisters lots of luck and fun!

title: Cosplay Posing Workshop
description: Want to take your cosplay or J-fashion photos taken at conventions or during photoshoots to the next level? Visit this interactive workshop, and learn easy and practical tips and tricks on what to do in front of the camera!
webDescription:
During this interactive workshop, Yomi (@yomiscreactivefragment), Lisa (@c3lestial_cosplay), and Floor (@floor_sophie_cosplay) will share practical tips and tricks for posing in front of the camera. Everyone is welcome to join: from beginners to those with more experience in posing. From cosplayers to Harajuku style fashionistas, and to photographers who would like to learn more about how to assist their models. The workshop will touch upon what to do during a quick photo opportunity in the convention hallways, and on how to take your big off-con photoshoot photos to the next level.

From the big basics to the tiniest details, from solo poses to posing as a big group, from fierce to cute, from how to work with props to how to work with big capes and dresses, this workshop will include as many things as possible in our time slot! We will also be taking audience requests, so if you have a specific cosplay character, difficult pose, or unique vibe or theme you need help with, we invite you to join our workshop and let us know your request! Even though the workshop is interactive, you are free to sit and listen as much as you are free to join us and try out poses on the spot. If you have any questions about the workshop, feel free to contact Yomi on Instagram. See you at AnimeCon!

title: The Wonderful World of Sake
rules:
• You need to show some ID to proof you are 18 years or older.
  • Must not be the designated driver.
  • Please refrain from talking during the presentation.
  • Feel free to talk when tasting the sake.

Additional information

  • As it is a tasting you do not have to finish each drink, though you are free to do so.
  • As we are concerned about our visitor's health, there is water available to drink.
  • You do not need to “clean your palate” with water between each sake, though again you are free to do so.
description: Many people have tasted just one type of sake and think that that's where the journey ends. This sake tasting shows (and lets you taste) how wide the variety of experiences of sake can be. Join this event and discover real sake, or Nihonshu as they call it in Japan.
webDescription:
Using just the simple ingredients of rice, pure water and koji (a type of yeast), brewers in Japan create a wide variety of sake. Or as they call it in Japan: Nihonshu. Add in some extra ingredients and the variety explodes.

On Friday you will taste several unique white label sakes. The sake on Saturday will be just as unique with several flower yeast sakes.

The first sake tasting for AnimeCon dates back to Almelo 2009. Since then we have been showing The Wonderful World of Sake every festival and this year you will also be able to taste a number of fantastic unique sake, some even hard to get in Japan.

Your tour guide, as always, will be Simon Hofstra who has been introducing us to new sake since 2009. He gained in-depth knowledge of sake as sommelier at the Okura hotel, then brought quality sake to Dutch supermarkets working for Vinites. Currently, he is one of the powers behind sake.nl as the owner of Taste of Sake.

You can visit the Japanese Liquor store “Ma Sake” on Friday and Saturday in Oldebroek, their online shop is 24/7 open at www.sake.nl

If you want to dive even deeper into the world of sake, you can also take one of the sake courses of the Wine & Spirit Education Trust, where you will meet Simon as instructor. Learn more about this Sake course at www.tasteofsake.com

title: Cosplay Catwalk
description: (Re-)Introducing… AnimeCon's Cosplay Catwalk!
webDescription:
Do you have a cosplay outfit that you're proud of? Would you like to show off your love for a certain character by strutting your stuff on our secondary stage? Do the main cosplay competitions intimidate you? Then our catwalk is the place to be!

Your outfit doesn't need to be made by hand, nor 100% accurate. It doesn't even need to be made of fabric or crafting foam. Cardboard, tinfoil, all is welcome. So long as you're dressed up as a fictional character, you're allowed to join our catwalk line-up. Cosplayers will be on stage for a short moment, showing off their outfit to the audience. No skit required! It's not a competition, it's a casual show! Each participant will, however, receive lovely goodies provided by our sponsor: the Foamtastische Huiskamer!

You may sign up through our special Google Form up until Thursday June 8th, 23:59 (11:59 PM)! After that, please report to the Secondary Stage on Friday 17:00, so that one of our dedicated Cosplay Crew members may direct you backstage in time for the catwalk.

description:
You may have heard about Japan-Expo in Paris before, because it's the largest Japanese Pop-culture related event outside of Japan. Ten years ago, they started a Pan-European Costume or Cosplay competition where only the Top 15 European Cosplay countries can compete!
The Netherlands is of course considered as one of these fifteen countries! Japan-Expo, in its wisdom has chosen AnimeCon as the event that will send the Dutch representatives to the European Cosplay Gathering (ECG) at Japan-Expo in July! You can win an expenses paid trip including hotel rooms to Japan-Expo where you will have to compete and represent The Netherlands at the European Cosplay Gathering and hopefully win fabulous prizes there!

description: A workshop hosted by Oranda no Panda. Needle felting is a new and very popular trend in the Japanese craft scene. Three dimensional objects can be sculpted with the use of a felting needle and unspun wool.
webDescription: Please join the workshop and make your very first needle felt plushie! Just remember that if you want to be assured a place in the workshop, you'll need to sign up at the AnimeCon Registration Desk beforehand.

title: Parapara Dance Workshop
description: Parapara is a very easy just-for-fun dance style, straight out of the Japanese clubs! We will teach you the basics and a few routines! No dancing skills are required!
webDescription:
Parapara is a popular Japanese synchronized group dance, closely related to Eurobeat. The basics of parapara are simple: step from left to right on the beat. Parapara routines normally contain easy lower body movements combined with a large variety of arm & hand movements. It’s not very difficult which also makes it suitable for people without a lot of dance experience, parapara dancing is for fun! So if you feel like dancing, then make sure to drop by this event filled with music and entertainment!

Check out these videos for some parapara action:
Largest Parapara party in Tokyo: https://youtu.be/2v-T0WaZYZg 
Parapara in the Efteling: https://youtu.be/EII9YGD8eWk  

What’s Para2Fine?
It’s a Dutch parapara team located in Eindhoven! They organize monthly parapara meetings and host dance events on various conventions such as AnimeCon 2019!
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/user/Paraparajin/ 
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/para2fine/

title: Eva Foam Cosplay Craft Workshop
description: Learn to work with EVA foam and all the different tools that you can use. Guided by experienced crafters, both advanced cosplayers and beginners can start crafting their own cosplay projects with EVA foam and tools.
webDescription:
At the EVA Foam Cosplay Crafting workshop by CosplayClues, you will learn how to work with EVA foam and all the different tools that you can use.

With our tips and tricks, both advanced cosplay crafters and beginners can start crafting their own cosplay projects. You will also get the chance to get started with EVA foam and various tools under experienced guidance.

The workshop is hosted by G4Gcosplay and Pinkzedart from CosplayClues.

title: Hentai Voice Over
description: During the Hentai Voice Over, participants get to voice specially selected clips from all of your favorite hentai series. Come watch, or participate, for guaranteed hilarity.
webDescription:
Does this sound familiar? You’re watching a hentai series, and you think: ‘the moaning, the horrible dialogues. I could do that better myself!’ Well, here’s your chance to prove it.

Participants will get a short hentai clip, and will have to create a funny voice over on the spot on stage. So, if you’re feeling creative, or if you just want to watch people voice over some horrible 18+ anime, come to the Hentai Voice Over!

The Hentai Voice Over will be hosted by Nishicon.

http://www.nishicon.nl

title: Karaoke by Asgard Sings!
description: Asgard Sings! will provide you with the best openings, golden oldies and loads of other songs to sing to. With a wide selection to choose from, we're sure there'll be something for everyone!
webDescription:
Everybody loves to sing, even if we don't want to admit it. Be it at home, in the car, or on stage. While we can't listen to your voice at your place, and you drive too fast to hear more than one word, we can provide you with the stage. Asgard Sings! will host the karaoke at AnimeCon and will allow you to sing to your favourite songs. Furthermore, besides singing to the songs on demand, Asgard Sings! will host several events. 

Besides the normal competition, we'll be hosting a Thor's Voice Battle (karaoke competition) and an Anime Music Quiz (a quiz).

Thor's Voice Battle


Thor's Voice Battle is a karaoke competition. We will judge your karaoke performance, the singing, crowd entertainment and party skills. You can choose any of our songs. 15 participants can join.

Do you think you have what it takes to win this karaoke competition? If so, sign up by sending a mail to competition@asgardsings.nl or by messaging our Facebook page.
the competition will take place on sunday between 14:00-15:00

Anime Music Quiz
The Anime Music Quiz tests your knowledge about intros and endings of your favourite series. A small audio fragment will be played after which you will have to guess which series it's from. Whoever scores the most points, wins! You can enter in groups.

Do you think you know the openings of your favorite anime? If so, sign up for the music quiz by writing a mail to competition@asgardsings.nl or by messaging our Facebook page.
 the competition will take place on saturday between 14:00-15:00

Social media handles

Facebook -> https://facebook.com/AsgardSings
Instagram -> https://instagram.com/AsgardSings
Discord (nieuw) -> https://discord.gg/tqnxvmYeZF
Onze website -> https://asgardsings.nl

Iedereen houd van zingen, zelfs als we het niet willen toegeven. Of het nou thuis, in de auto of op stage is. Misschien kunnen we jouw stem niet horen bij jou thuis, of rij je te snel om meer dan één woord te horen, maar we kunnen je wel een podium bieden. Asgards Sings! presenteert de karaoke bij AnimeCon en biedt jou de kans om je favoriete liedjes te zingen. Verder, naast zingen naar liedjes on demand, presenteert Asgard Sings! verschillende events.

Naast de reguliere competitie, presenteren we een Thor's Voice Battle (karaoke competitie) en een Anime Music Quiz.

Thor's Voice Battle
Thor's Voice Battle is een karaoke competitie. Wij zullen gaan kijken naar hoe jullie optreden, het publiek entertainen en of er een mooi feestje van gemaakt wordt. Er kan gekozen worden uit al onze liedjes en er is plek voor 15 deelnemers.

Denk jij het in je te hebben om te winnen in deze karaoke competitie? Zo ja, schrijf je dan in door een mail te sturen naar competition@asgardsings.nl of door ons een bericht te sturen op onze Facebook pagina. 
De wedstrijd zal zondag plaatsvinden tussen 14:00-15:00

 

Anime Music Quiz
De Anime Music Quiz test jouw kennis van de intros en endings van je favoriete series. Er zal een klein stukje audio afgespeeld worden waarna jullie vervolgens de serie moeten raden. Degene met de meeste punten wint. Je kan deelnemen in groepjes.

Denk jij de opening songs te kennen van jouw favoriete anime? Zo ja, schrijf je dan in door een mail te sturen naar competition@asgardsings.nl of door ons een bericht te sturen op onze Facebook pagina. 
De wedstrijd zal zaterdag plaatsvinden tussen 14:00-15:00

title: Eva Foam Textures
description:
Foam doesn’t need to be flat and boring.
---
Foam hoeft niet plat en saai te zijn.
webDescription:
Did you know there are many ways to add a cool texture to your foam to create a fake effect?

You will also learn which is the best way to prime your foam to create the most desired finish for your prop or costume.

 

Wist je dat er veel manieren zijn om coole texturen toe te voegen om een namaak effect te maken?

Je zal ook leren wat de beste manier is om je foam te primen om de meest begeerbare finish voor je prop of kostuum te creëren.

title: The Different Types of Cosplay Competitions
description:
Always wanted to enter a cosplay competition but not sure which one would fit your style the most?
---
Heb je altijd al mee willen doen aan een cosplay competitie maar weet je niet welke het beste past bij jouw stijl?
webDescription:
In this lecture we'll go over all the types of Cosplay competitions, what every competition includes and some tips and tricks! 


We will also talk about all the different international competitions and the differences between them all. And of course, what the international finals are like! 

Tijdens deze lecture hebben we het over de verschillende types cosplay competities, wat elke competitie inhoudt en wat tips en trucs.

We zullen ook praten over de verschillende internationale competities en het verschil daartussen. En natuurlijk, hoe de internationale finales zijn!

title: Cosplay Painting Techniques
description:
Learn about different painting techniques that can be applied to your cosplay.
---
Leer alles over verschillende verftechnieken die toegepast kunnen worden op jouw cosplay.
webDescription:
From dry brushing to cell-shading.

During this demo multiple techniques will be shown live to learn how to create the perfect finish for your prop or costume. 

Van dry brushing naar cell-shading.

Tijdens deze demo zullen meerdere technieken live aan je gedemonstreerd worden zodat je kan leren om de perfecte finish voor je prop of kostuum te maken.

title: Pepakura and Cosplay
description:
Did you know you can use Pepakura papercraft patterns to create armour or props for your cosplay?
---
Wist jij dat je Pepakura papercraft patronen kan gebruiken om een harnas of props voor je cosplay te maken?
webDescription:
By either using a ready-made pattern or a 3D model, you can ‘unfold’ these models into small, flat pieces which you can use to recreate them on EVA foam!

Even with basic papercraft knowledge, these patterns can be applied to foam. 

Door een bestaand patroon of 3d model te gebruiken, kan je deze modellen uitvouwen tot kleine platte delen die je kan gebruiken om ze na te maken met EVA foam!

Zelfs met wat basis papercraft kennis, kunnen deze patronen toegepast worden op foam.

title: Patterning Armour for Cosplay
description:
During this lecture we will show multiple ways to make your own patterns for your cosplay and how to use bought patterns.
---
Tijdens deze lectur laten we verschillende manieren zien om je eigen patronen voor je cosplay te maken en hoe je gekochte patronen kunt gebruiken.

title: Worbla Fireball
description:
Learn how to create a cute fireball-prop for your cosplay with Worbla Transpa Art and Worbla Crystal art.
---
Leer hoe je een schattige vuurbal-prop voor je cosplay met Worbla Transpa Art and Worbla Crystal Art kunt maken.
webDescription:
This tutorial is super beginner friendly and doesn’t require any knowledge about electronics.

Deze tutorial is super beginner vriendelijk en vereist geen kennis over electronica.

title: Freestyle Kintsugi
description: In this short version of Freestyle Kintsugi workshop, the participants will experience the philosophy of kintsugi, which embraces the flawed or imperfect. They will practice to accept the way things are and letting go of control. How? By ritually breaking dishes and glueing them together again in novel and golden ways.
webDescription:
Freestyle Kintsugi is an alternative way of Kintsugi workshop which is given regularly at Mediamatic in Amsterdam, by artist Mariko Hori



The workshop will start off with a purification ceremony, in which you will break dishes and embrace failure. You will then find pieces of dishes and found objects to fit them together and practice care and accept imperfection. Finally you will write history by gilding the cracks and joints of the objects in kintsugi technique.
ticketsInfo:
Host: Mariko Hori (F), korimariho@me.com & +316 4724 5101

- A gopher to help the host during the workshop

title: Ikebana - Flower Arrangement Workshop
description: Have you ever heard about Ikebana? Ikebana is a traditional Japanese flower arrangement. Let’s make  ikebana using a few lovely flowers!
webDescription:
Ikebana -Japanese flower arrangement, is one of the traditional arts of Japan. It has a rich and long history that spans 600 years! Can you believe it? In Japan, there are even hundreds of ikebana schools (styles).

A feature of ikebana is its asymmetric composition. A sense of harmony among the materials, color combinations, balance, empty space. The water and the container are also important features to consider. During the workshop you will create your own ikebana arrangement and experience the ikebana of Ikebana Ohara school. After the workshop, you can take your own ikebana home!

We'll be hosting four consecutive workshops, each lasting 30 minutes. One workshop may seat 6 participants. If you'd like to join, please don't forget to sign up first at our Registration Desk!

For more information: https://www.ikebana-ohara.nl/
ticketsInfo: - 1 gopher  benodigd voor verplaatsen van de materialen van de parkeerplek naar de workshopruimte

title: DMVDBERG Photography
description: Would you like to have an epic photo of your cosplay or convention look? Visit us at DMVDBERG Photography!
webDescription:
You’ve spent hours, days or weeks on your costume, and hard work will be rewarded with a stunning photo. We are just as passionate about cosplay as you.

Our team consists of professional photographers, costume designers and LARPers. All with a passion for anime, cosplay and costume design in general. If you would like a real professional portrait of your hard work, you’re visiting the right booth! Every portrait is special, even more so during conventions. Especially since we can finally meet and show off our cosplays and hard work. 

All photos are delivered digitally in High Resolution directly during AnimeCon, but a print option is also available and will be sent to your home address. So no worries about folds or damage to the beautiful print you ordered. At our fine art style set we can really make you and your costume shine. Our mission is to make the best art portrait possible.

During AnimeCon you can also find us walking the floor. Feel free to say hi and have your picture taken with friends on the spot

Price

Having your pictures taken is free. Each photo will help us cover costs and ensure we will be back next year, help us out via: ‘Pay what you want’. We have a QR code you can scan for donations.

title: Jan Ken Pon
description: Jan Ken Pon is the most exciting form of rock paper scissors you'll ever experience!
webDescription:
Have fun playing rock paper scissors, but more extreme. When you win, you get to slap your opponent with a fan. If you lose, quickly defend yourself with a helmet. Each round, new rules are  added to keep things interesting. Jan-ken-pon your way through the tournament, and who knows? You just might become the winner of the AnimeCon Cup.

 

 

Speel gezellig steen-papier-schaar, maar dan extremer. Wanneer je wint, moet je de tegenstander raken met een waaier. Als je verliest, verdedig je jezelf met een 'helm'. Elke ronde komen er nieuwe regels bij om het interessant te houden. Jan-ken-pon jezelf door het toernooi en wie weet wordt jij de winnaar van de Animecon Cup.
prizes: Één totaalpakket prijzen voor Kinjin. Zie e-mail naar Steyn.

A good old-fashioned Bingo night, but you don't stamp any numbers. Anything can be called, from Naruto to Vocaloid. When you win, cry out in Japanese… Bingo!


Een leuke ouderwetse Bingo avond, maar je stempelt geen nummers af! Alles kan voorbij komen, van Naruto tot Vocaloid. En als je wint, dan schreeuw je op zijn Japans... Bingo!

description: Do you think you know a lot about anime, manga and Japan? Then join the Otaku Quiz!
webDescription:
If Japanese (pop-)culture knowledge is buzzing through your brain, this is the interactive quiz for you. Trust no one and make your way to the correct answer. There's prizes to be won!


Als je hoofd vol zit met Japanse (pop-)cultuur, doe mee met onze interactieve quiz. Vertrouw niemand en baan je een weg naar het goede antwoord. Er zijn prijzen om gewonnen te worden!

title: Kinjin Cards
description: It's the Kinjin Cardgame hours, featuring two different little games at the same time! Stop on by for Cards Against Anime and Guess Who? Anime Edition.
webDescription:
Kinjin will be hosting two different card games: Guess Who? and Cards Against Anime. With Guess Who? you try to guess your opponent's anime character by asking closed yes-no questions. With Cards Against Anime, you try to give the funniest answer to a silly question, but with a Japanese theme!


Kinjin organiseert twee verschillende kaartspellen: Wie is het en Cards Against Anime. Bij wie is het probeer je het anime karakter van de tegenstander te raden door gesloten ja-nee vragen te stellen. Bij Cards Against Anime probeer je het grappigste antwoord te geven op een gekke vraag, maar dan met een Japans thema.

title: Enhance Your Dual-wielding Skills
description: You will be given the opportunity to enhance your dual-wielding skills in a workshop. Participants will be introduced to the basics of dual sword wielding. After the basic level the advanced techniques will be shared and practiced.
webDescription:
Martial art school Um Yang Kwon will give you the opportunity to an introduction of the dual-wielding skills using twin swords. In the workshop we start with the basic of the dual sword wielding. After the basic we will continue with the more advanced techniques. These technique were written down in the Muyedobotongji, or Comprehensive Illustrated Manual of Martial Arts (1790 in Korea). Not exclusive for Korea but originate in the technic exchange from China, Korea and Japan centuries before the manual was written. The twin sword techniques were part of the officers examination in China and in Korea.

Martial art school Um Yang Kwon www.umyangkwon.nl is located in Den Haag. The main instructor, Misha Lisetsky, of Um Yang Kwon will introduce you to the Twin Swords. He is the representative of the Korean Hapkido Federation in the Netherlands and international certified martial arts instructor. Active, focus on Hapkido, Xsing Yi, Speer, Long Stick and of course Twin Swords.

title: Experiencing Hidden Powers You All Have
description: In this workshop about the unique training-method Andi-do, you will not only feel various hidden powers that lie dormant within you, you will also experience how easily you can draw from these forces we all possess and use them to stand your ground in life.
webDescription:
This may sound like an exaggeration, but all you need to do is attend the workshop to convince yourself of how true this is.
Andi-do is the name of the foundation as well as the name of a relatively new training-method. Andi-do does not pretend to have discovered the wheel. What it has done, however, is looking carefully and critically at many of the already existing training-methods, self-defense sports and techniques and filtering out all that really works and can be useful. All the non-useful, not really good and/or unnecessary techniques and ceremonies are simply left out. The things that can help to make people stronger and more resilient, focused, positive, relaxed and defensible, and therefore more effective in all kinds of situations in life, are (sometimes after some improvement) molded in one overall training called Andi-do. At the same time, there is also emphasis on having a fun training suitable for everyone. In its search for valuable supplementation, Andi-do continuously checks every mental and/or physical method/sport/technique it encounters . 
All of this makes Andi-do very broad, useful, effective, no-nonsense and of course a lot of fun.

Because we strongly feel that the importance lies not only in what is taught but also very much in how it is taught, we are very selective as far as trainers are concerned. That is the reason why Andi-do is not well known (yet).

More information in Dutch can be found on our website www.andido.nl, but it mainly focuses on training for children. If you might have special questions (or even requests) prior to the workshop, you can always contact us by mail info@andido.nl.

title: The Iga Warrior of Enlightenment
description: The Iga Warrior of Enlightenment will host a beautiful demonstration and workshop on Saturday June 11th at AnimeCon.
webDescription:
The Iga Warrior an organisation that teaches authentic ninja and samurai training, in order to develop the body, mind and confidence. They host lessons in effective techniques of many different ninja and samurai styles.

You can divide these styles into two sub-sections. These sub-sections are:
a) Taijutsu (close combat). This is a very broad method which uses natural movements of the body. Through this, the Iga Warrior ninja/samurai can prevent harmful injuries to themselves, while disarming their opponent. It's a system that works independently from weight, length and power of a person. The Iga Warrior ninja knows how to adapt in any situation. Spontaneity and creativity play an important role. Every situation is different, after all, and must be approached differently. You never know who you might face and what sort of martial arts background that person has. But the Iga Warrior ninja learns to be creative and spontaneous, and to expected the unexpected, so that they can react to any situation in the proper manner, the way their body indicates they should.

b) Kobujutsu. The weapon fighting of The Iga Warrior is based on effectively using all weapons. For that reason, Kobujutsu is an extension of Taijutsu. You will learn to use anything as a weapon, whether it's a pen, a suitcase or a purse. Anything is fair game to defend yourself with. When learning the weapon techniques, you not only learn thrust, stab and swipe techniques, you'll also learn locks, holds, throws and pressure point techniques. Naturally, you'll learn about traditional weapons first.


------------------------

The Iga Warrior is een organisatie die lesgeeft in authentieke Ninja en Samurai Training ter ontwikkeling van lichaam, geest en zelfvertrouwen. Er wordt les gegeven in effectieve technieken van vele verschillende ninja en namurai stijlen. 

Je kan deze stijlen weer onderverdelen in 2 onderdelen. Deze onderdelen zijn:
a) Het Taijutsu (close combat, lege handen vechten). Dit is van naturen een veel omvattende methode die gebruikt maakt van de natuurlijke bewegingen van het lichaam. Hierdoor kan de Iga Warrior ninja/samurai schadelijke blessures (letsel) bij zichzelf voorkomen, terwijl hij de tegenstander onschadelijk maakt (dit kan ook doormiddel van een klem of greep). Het is een systeem dat onafhankelijk is van het gewicht, de lengte en de kracht van de persoon. De Iga Warrior ninja weet zich in elke situatie aan te passen. Spontaniteit en creativiteit spelen een belangrijke rol. Elke situatie is immers anders en moet anders worden aangepakt. Je weet nooit wie er tegenover je komt te staan en wat voor gevechtsachtergrond de ander heeft. Maar de Iga Warrior ninja leert om creatief en spontaan te zijn en het onverwachte te verwachten, zodat hij op elke situatie en op de juiste manier, zoals zijn lichaam het aangeeft, kan reageren.

Het Taijutsu is weer onderverdeeld in drie onderdelen. Deze onderdelen zijn:
1. Ninpo Taihenjutsu (Lichaamsbeweging) is ook onder te verdelen in 2 onderdelen:
 Ninpo Ukemi, Nagare en Kaiten (Valbreken, rollen, bodydrops enz.)
 Ninpo Tobi (Springen, duik sprong, rollen enz.).
2. Ninpo Dakentaijutsu (Slaan -, stoot - en traptechnieken) is ook onder te verdelen in 3 onderdelen:
 Ninpo Koppojutsu (Aanvallen op de botten en botbreektechnieken),
 Ninpo Koshijutsu (Aanvallen op de spieren)
 Ninpo Kyusho (Drukpunt technieken).
3. Ninpo Jutaijutsu (Worstelachtige technieken) is ook onder te verdelen in 4 onderdelen:
 Ninpo Nage (Worpen en gooien),
 Ninpo Gyakuwaza (Grepen en klemmen. Het onder controle brengen van de tegenstander.),
 Ninpo Shimewaza (Verwurgingen)
 Ninpo Hajutsu (Ontsnappingen).

b) Het Kobujutsu. Het wapen vechten van The Iga Warrior is gebaseerd op het effectief gebruiken van alle wapens. Het Kobujutsu is ook het verlengde van het Taijutsu. Je leert eigenlijk alles als wapen te gebruiken of het nu een pen, koffer of een handtasje is, je leert alles te gebruiken om je effectief te verdedigen. Bij de wapentechnieken krijg je niet alleen maar stoot -, steek- en slag- technieken, maar ook klemmen, grepen, worpen en drukpunt technieken. We leren natuurlijk eerst de traditionele wapens. 

Je gaat in de volgende wapentrainingen les krijgen:
 Ninpo Hanbojutsu (1 meter lang stokvechten)
 Ninpo Tessejutsu (30 cm lange stokvechten)
 Ninpo Yawarajutsu (wapenstokvechten)
 Ninpo Jojutsu (1 (m) 28 (cm) Lange stokvechten)
 Ninpo Rokushakubojutsu (1 (m) 80 (cm) lange stokvechten)
 Ninpo Tantojutsu (mesvechten)
 Ninpo Kenjutsu (zwaardvechten)
 Ninpo Kamajutsu (sikkelvechten)
 Ninpo Kusari-fundojutsu (kettingvechten)
 Ninpo Sojutsu (speervechten)
 Ninpo Nagenatejutsu (hellebaardvechten)
 Ninpo Juttejutsu (saivechten) En nog veel meer…

title: Japan’s Mowing Blade, Naginata
description: An introduction into the techniques of the Japanese halberd, the mowing blade of the warrior monks and the samurai, the Naginata. In this workshop you will learn the basic stance and some of the basic body movements and strikes.
webDescription:
Naginata, the mowing blade. The halberd of the Samurai and the warrior monks of Japan was a weapon made famous in many stories. Today the techniques of the weapon still remain in some of the old schools, but also in a martial art with the name Naginata.

The martial art of Naginata was introduced in the Netherlands in the 70s. Today Naginata is still a small martial art compared to some others. Only a handful of dojo exist. However, the instructors in the Netherlands are among the highest ranked in Europe and have achieved top 3 results in several European and World Championships in recent years.

Come and try the workshop Naginata to learn the basic stances and some of the basic body movements and strikes.

For more information about where to practice Naginata in the Netherlands:
http://www.naginata.nl/dojo

For more information about Naginata:
https://youtu.be/62XsKcyUiag

title: RyuKyu Kobujutsu
description: In this workshop, we will let you experience what it's like to practise Kobujutsu by teaching you some basic techniques with the Bo. You also can get a taste of what some of the other weapons feel like.
webDescription:
Ryukyu Kobujutsu, the ancient martial art of the Ryukyu Islands, consists of "Toshu-jutsu" (empty hand techniques) and "Emono-jutsu" (weapon techniques). Nowadays they are generally considered two different arts - "Karate" and "Ryukyu Kobujutsu".

Karate is well known throughout the world, but Kobujutsu not so. This is a shame because Kobujutsu too is a beautiful martial art.

In Kobujutsu eight kinds of weapons are used: Bo, Sai, Tonfa, Nunchaku, Kama, Tekko, Tinbe and Surujin. Each weapon with its own characteristics.

Lu Gia Jen is the Dojo where great instructors teach Kobujutsu 3 times a week. 

The workshop will be fit for everyone, also people who have no experience with martial arts at all. There are no physical requirements other than being able to hold a weapon.


If you would like to know more about Kobujutsu or the other sports that are taught at Andi-do or Lu Gia Jen you can take a look at these websites:

www.andido.nl

www.lugiajen.nl

www.rkkobujutsu.nl


Of course, you can also ask your questions at the workshop.

title: Pencak Silat
description: Come and witness the Pencak Silat workshop by Lu Gia Jen!
webDescription:
Pencak Silat is a martial art from Southeast Asia. The name Pencak Silat is used in Indonesia. In Malaysia, one speaks of Bersilat and in the Philippines of Kali Silat. Pencak (pronounced pentjak) literally means: (specialized) movement(s). Silat (from kilat) means in this context: fast as lightning. “Bersilat” means "to be busy with silat", or in other words “practicing Pencak Silat”.

As in Karate, Taekwondo, Thai- or Kickboxing and Kung Fu, Pencak Silat uses punches, kicks and parries. Punches, kicks and parries, however, frequently are combined with throws, sweeping techniques and clamp-/or breaking techniques. Like the ones encountered in Judo, Jiu Jitsu and Aikido. That makes Pencak Silat a versatile martial art.

title: Photobooth
description: The guys of the Photobooth presenting the Dutch version of a Japanese Purikura
webDescription:
For the second time, AnimeCon presents a real Photobooth!
Have you ever heard of a Purikura? These are Japanese photo booths where
you can make a fun photo strip. So not one of those gray boxes that you
can see here in the Netherlands. You can make the photos you take here
as fun as you want. The AnimeCon presents a modified Dutch version of
the Purikura! All this is provided by the Jongens van de photobooth!

title: Tea Ceremony
description: Always wanted to attend a Japanese Tea Ceremony? Now is your chance! Join Ambaran and experience tea the Japanese way.
webDescription:
Ready for a quiet moment of meditation during your busy convention weekend? Would you like to have a taste of traditional Japanese culture? Visit the Japanese tea ceremony hosted by Ambaran Artgroup. The Ambaran Artgroup will hold a Japanese Tea Ceremony where you will taste, enjoy, and learn 

About the special ceremony that Japan has held dear since the 12th century CE. You will hear about the intricacies of a Tea Ceremony, the type of tea that is used, as well as the rituals that are upheld in a Tea Ceremony club.

A Tea Ceremony is never complete without a taste of course! Have a delicious cup of matcha tea, prepared professionally for you by the sisters comprising Ambaran. Alongside the matcha tea, you will enjoy some traditional Japanese sweets: mochi! Experience inner peace with a Japanese twist like never before!

How to Lip Sync is a collection of tips and tricks that can help you improve your lip syncing skills for TikTok, cosplay, acting competitions, and CMV.

title: Zwaardspel Presents; Hollywood Stunt
description: Duration: 45 min, plus 15 min of open-mat and Q&A. This class will focus on Basics of Stunt Fighting. All ages and characters welcome!
webDescription:
Join us to learn the basics of stunt fighting and stunt sword play! Because like... stunt fighting is for everyone!

We welcome you to a presentation in sword-fight and a workshop in stage-fight. Do you want to learn how to fight like an Anime character- safely? Do you want to “know” the moves you yell out before swinging your sword or throw your fists? Come to the workshop to learn how to swing a sword and throw a punch... without really fighting or killing anyone. 

We do our best to provide a safe place for everyone to learn these moves while having a ton of fun!!!

Jeff Carr from the US and Egon Adel from Amsterdam have been giving lessons in sword-play and stage-fighting for almost ten years. So channel your inner Deku or Luffy, Sally, Kenshin, or Mikasa, and meet us at Clara's Combat Dojo!


Note: We do not recommend fighting with swords in your mouth or chainsaws attached to your face. Even if it looks totally bad-ass!!!

Outside AnimeCon, we also do birthdays, bachelor/ette parties and school functions, but we also love working alongside festivals. We easily accommodate a certain age or mixed aged groups. Our class/workshop can be open and continuous or set in rotations of groups or at starting times. Whatever is best for you, is great for us! If you are interested in having us, please contact me or my partner. We offer all classes in Dutch or English. All ages/characters welcome!

www.zwaardspel.nl
www.facebook.com/zwaardspel

title: Aikido
description: Would you like to know more about aikido, also known as harmonious self-defense? Then this is the workshop for you.
webDescription:
Lu Gia Jen is a budoclub with several martial arts. It was founded in 1956 and has now existed for more than sixty years. With over 750 members, Lu Gia Jen is assigned as one of the most complete martial arts associations of The Hague. Besides Judo, one can also practice Jiu Jitsu, Karate, Kobujutsu, Aikido and Pencak Silat. Every year, Lu Gia Jen organizes the International Residence Judo Tournament with more than 1500 participants.

At Lu Gia Jen, they will teach all there is to know about Aikido: Harmonious self-defense. It has been developed from the century old Samurai art of defense. Aikido can be seen as a tool from the art of movement, philosophy and self-defense. Bringing the attacker under control is the goal, and the well taught Aikidoka has many possibilities to achieve this goal.

In practice, it is a very pleasant budo form (Japanese martial art) for young and old, man or woman. The lack of the competitive element ensures that there is no winner. You make use of the power and speed of the opponent, by neutralizing their attack. Come and join this workshop!

title: Karate
description: Are you interested in becoming the next Karate Kid? Why not attend Lu Gia Jen's karate workshop?
webDescription: Many people associate karate with the breaking of bricks, or a high jump and flying kick in the air. None of this is the essence of karate. Karate literally means empty (kara) hand (te). Karate is about 200 years old. It originated in China under the collective name Chuan Fa. It was influenced in the long run by Okinawa, Thailand, Taiwan and eventually Japan.

title: Jiu Jitsu
description: Jiu-Jitsu is another interesting martial arts style. Come and attend Lu Gia Jen's workshop!
webDescription: Jiu-jitsu was developed among the samurai of feudal Japan as a method for defeating an armed and armored opponent in which one uses no weapon, or only a short weapon. Because striking against an armored opponent proved ineffective, practitioners learned that the most efficient method for neutralizing an enemy was by using crimps, joint locks and throws. These techniques were developed around the principle of using an attacker's energy against him, rather than directly opposing it.

title: Weerwolven met EsmeraldaCosplay
description: Group games lead by EsmeraldaCosplay - weerwolven van wakkerdam
webDescription:
Hello, my name is Esmeralda and I have been active in the cosplay community for about 10 years. Making and wearing cosplays is one of my biggest passions. From Pokémon, to Borderlands, to Disney; my costumes are all over the place.


I love nothing more than sharing my passion with others, so I capture all my cosplay convention adventures through vlogs and share them on my YouTube channel: Esmeralda Cosplay. I also regularly share my passion for cosplay as an elementary school teacher between classes with my grade 8 students. There is nothing more important than passing on to others that it is totally okay to be yourself and have non-mundane hobbies!

Besides socializing, one of my favourite things to do as a teacher is to play the game ''Werewolves of Wakkerdam'' with a group. So this is the game I'm taking to Animecon this year! A game of treachery and deception, where cunning pays off. In which you must play in two teams to try to eliminate the other team by playing cleverly. The only note: the team of ''the wolves'' knows that they form a team together, the other team, ''the civilians'', do not know each other's role. A super cool game, which you really must try out at least once!

Curious about my cosplay adventures? Here is a little sneak-peak of my adventures at Animecon last year: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bLXDY-DpM6s&t=199s As you can see, I also like to rock out at Karaoke By Asgard Sings! haha.

Would you also like to join a game of Werewolves? Or just have a chat? Then I would love to see you Friday and Saturday between 20:00 and 22:00 at Animecon in the Workshops room located on the Exp Plaza!

Hallo! Mijn naam is Esmeralda en ik ben sinds een jaar of 10 actief in de cosplay community. Het maken en dragen van cosplays is een van mijn grootste passies. Van Pokémon, tot Borderlands, tot Disney; mijn kostuums zijn all over the place.


Ik vind niks leuker dan mijn passie met andere delen, al mijn cosplay conventie avonturen leg ik dan ook vast via vlogs en deel ik op mijn YouTube kanaal: Esmeralda Cosplay. Daarnaast deel ik mijn passie voor cosplay ook regelmatig als basisschool juf tussen de lessen door aan mijn groep 8 leerlingen. Niks zo belangrijk als aan anderen mee te geven dat het helemaal oké is om jezelf te zijn en niet alledaagse hobby's te hebben!

Naast gezellig babbelen, is een van mijn favoriete dingen om te doen als juf het spel ''Weerwolven van Wakkerdam'' te spelen met een groep. Dit spel neem ik dit jaar dan ook mee naar Animecon! Een spel van verraad en misleiding, waar sluwheid loont. Waarin je in twee teams moet proberen door slim te spelen het andere team eruit te werken. De enige kanttekening: het team van ''de wolven'' weet van elkaar dat zij samen een team vormen, het andere team, ''de burgers'', kennen elkaars rol niet. Een super tof spel, wat je echt een keer gedaan moet hebben!

Benieuwd naar mijn cosplay avonturen? Hier een kleine sneak-peak van mijn avonturen bij Animecon vorig jaar: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bLXDY-DpM6s&t=199s Zoals je kan zien ben ik ook te vinden bij Karaoke By Asgard Sings! haha.
 

Lijkt het jou ook leuk om ook een potje Weerwolven mee te doen? Of even een babbeltje te maken? Dan zie ik je graag vrijdag en zaterdag tussen 20:00 en 22:00 op Animecon in de Workshops ruimte te vinden op de Exp Plaza!

title: Tea Tasting
description: Tea, everybody knows it, and most people love it. However, there are many flavours and aspects of tea that you may not know. Come to this tasting for an introduction to the different types and varieties that tea has to offer.
webDescription:
This tasting is an introduction to tea and its history. Having already been drank for thousands of years, tea has a rich tradition and culture that we will explore. While each cup of tea has a taste, it usually also has a story. These tastes and those stories are the focus of this workshop that we will explore. With a taste of the different teas and the story on how it got there, this is a workshop that anybody can join.

So come, join and get a re-introduction to a drink you've had so often before, as we show it to you in a whole new light.


Please note, this workshop is first come, first served! If you want to be sure you can participate, please show up bright and early by our Tastings Area.
ticketsInfo: Jeroen van der Vaart; jeroen@animecon.nl; 004917641580537

description: Are you a Pokémon fanatic? A trainer extraordinaire? Then get ready and try to be the very best at our stand in the Exp Plaza! We're hosting some exciting tournaments during the convention, including Pokémon Go and single/double battles for Pokémon Scarlet and Violet
webDescription:
Are you a Pokémon fanatic? A trainer extraordinaire? Then get ready and try to be the very best at our stand in the Exp Plaza! We're hosting some exciting tournaments during the convention, including Pokémon Go and single/double battles for Pokémon Scarlet and Violet

To enter, simply swing by our stand and register your team of six Pokémon, along with your friend code for the game you'll be competing in. It's the ultimate chance to prove your skills and battle it out with other top trainers.

But that's not all! If you're up for a real challenge, why not try your hand at becoming the best trainer of ancient times, just like in Legends of Arceus and calm down one of the great lords? Or take on our collection challenge in Area Zero. Gonna catch ‘em all,

And if that's not your style, maybe you're all about style itself! Do you have the prettiest trainer card in the theme of this convention? Then show it off and let everyone see your creativity.

So what are you waiting for? Come and join us at our stand .For more information, check out our social media or just come and chat with us in person. We can't wait to see you there!

 

Legend of Arceus. Lord Kleavor

Do you have the skills of the ancient trainers to calm down this noble Pokémon? Then go to our  stand and give it a try. The trainer who is able to do this in the shortest amount of time will receive a price at the end of the convention

Area zero collection challenge

The future will hold many strange Pokémon’s. These Pokémon’s are a disaster for the environment if they escape from the crater. It is on us to hold them back and catch as many as possible of them.

Each trainer has 7,5 minutes to go down the crater and earn points by catching Pokémon’s.

·         For each normal Pokémon, you get 1 point

·         For each unique paradox Pokémon you get 3 points

·         For all other paradox Pokémon you get 1 point

·         You get a additional 15 points if you complete the collection log (all paradox pokémon’s)

·         You get 10 points if you end on miraidon’s spiral on time

Trainer card of the sea

With this year theme “under the sea”, we cannot stay behind. Take a picture of your trainer card in this theme and upload it on our Instagram or facebook. At the end of the convention we will judge the trainer cards and the best one will receive a price.

 

Ben je een Pokémon fan? Een trainer extraordinaire? Zorg dan dat je klaar  bent om de allerbeste te zijn op onze stand op de Exp Plaza! We hosten spannende Pokémon toernooien, waaronder Pokémon Go en Single/Double battles in Pokémon Scarlet & Violet.

Om je aan te melden kom langs bij onze stand en registreer je team van zes pokémon, samen met je friendcode. Dit is de ultieme kans om je skills uit te testen en het uit te vechten met andere top trainers.

Maar dat is niet alles! Als je voor een echte uitdaging in bent, probeer dan de beste trainer van het verleden te worden, net zoals in Legends of Arceus. Of ga onze collectie uitdaging aan in Area Zero. Gonna catch 'em all!

En mocht dat je stijl niet zijn, misschien is stijl zelf jouw ding! Heb je de mooiste trainer card in het thema van de conventie? Laat dan aan iedereen je creativiteit zien!

Dus waar wacht je nog op? Kom en join onze stand. Voor meer informatie, check onze social media of kom een praatje maken op de locatie. We kunnen niet wachten om jullie te zien!

title: Core Focus Photography
description: Come take a look at Core Focus Photography for all kinds of tips and tricks! From model directing, photography and LEDs for your cosplay!
webDescription:
Core Focus Photography

What do I pay attention to when posing? What is the easiest way to direct my model? Core Focus Photography will give you tips and tricks that you can use during any photoshoot.

You can ask any questions about photography in general: posing, directing a model, what settings to use on your camera, in short anything to do with photography. We will organize short live shoots in which you can ask all your questions about a photoshoot. This goes for models as well as photographers. Stopping by to have a nice chat is of course always more than welcome ;-)

Core Focus Photography

Waar let ik op bij poseren? Hoe stuur ik het beste mijn model aan? Tips en tricks voor tijdens een fotoshoot krijg je van Core Focus Photography.

Bij Core Focus Photography kun je terecht met al je vragen over fotografie: poseren, aansturen van een model, het instellen van je camera etc. Kortom alles rondom fotografie. Tevens worden er korte sessies met een live shoot georganiseerd waarin je al je vragen kunt stellen over een fotoshoot. Dit geldt voor zowel modellen als voor fotografen. Gezellig even langskomen voor een babbeltje is natuurlijk ook altijd goed ;-)

title: The Blind Pig: Bingo Mystery Hunt
description: Are you a fan of hunting for clues? Then join The Blind Pig's mystery hunt!
webDescription:
You will be tasked with filling out a bingo card by completing mini-games! After filling out the bingo card you will be able to hand in your vote for the popularity contest between the merpeople and air people!

There are two tribes that have been living around AnimeCon Island: the merpeople and the airpeople. They have been fighting for supremacy for centuries. A popularity contest is held to determine the final victor! Two representatives have been sent to spread awareness and collect votes for the popularity contest: Lucy from the airpeople and Vinny from the merpeople. 

Earn your right to vote, and help resolve this age long dispute!

No-sign up required. You can participate at any given time during the day before the event ends. Feel free to come by the Blind Pig's table in the Exp Plaza to participate or ask for more information.

title: VA Guest: Rachelle Heger
description: AnimeCon is proud to present our guests of honour for this year! We have invited two international voice actors who are known for numerous anime, western animations and video games.
webDescription:
Rachelle is a professional voice actress and singer originally from Boston. 
She has been in a variety of projects, including various video games, animation projects and commercials. Since she was little, Rachelle has always been singing and acting, whether it be on stage or in her parents’ living room. She discovered her passion for acting and singing when she started to participate in musicals in high school, the first being “Kismet”. 

You might know her from series and games like Lego Friends, Fire Emblem: Engage (Celine, above), Omega Strikers, Final Fantasy VII, Smite, Eureka Seven, I've Been Killing Slimes... (Laika, below), Genshin Impact, Little Witch Academia (Sucy), and Shenmue III.

 

Together with Laura Post, Rachelle will be part of a Q&A, and will be signing portraits and items of characters she's voiced on all three days. The Q&A will be announced soon on the website! For up to date information about our guests please keep a close eye on our online schedule.

Laura and Rachelle will be signing every day during AnimeCon's opening times. Please bring cash, as we cannot guarantee there will be a debit card option.

title: VA Guest: Laura Post
description: AnimeCon is proud to present the 2023 voice actor guests! This year we have invited two top talents from the United States who have voiced many anime and super hero animations, as well as some awesome games!
webDescription:
Laura Post is one of the voice actresses we will welcome this year at AnimeCon. She doubles as a voice director, and has performed in a lot of anime series and games!

You may know her for her roles as Aria Lieze in Nanoha A's, Ragyo Kiryuin in Kill la Killl, Rosalia in Sword Art Online and Blizzard in One Punch Man amongst many, many others.

She also has portrayed characters in video games like Ahri in LOL, Queen Azshara in World of Warcraft Cataclysm, Harley Quinn in Batman: The Enemy Within, and many more!

Recent mobile gamers might know her from the smash hit from Mihoyo Genshin Impact where she voices Yelan!

 

 

Laura will be part of a Q&A with fellow voice actress Rachelle Heger, and she will also sign prints and items related to characters she has voiced. For up to date information about our guests please keep a close eye on our online schedule.

Laura and Rachelle will be signing every day during AnimeCon's opening times. Please bring cash, as we cannot guarantee there will be a debit card option.

title: Cosplay ≠ Consent
description: With cosplay nobody wants to feel bad or give a bad feeling to others. How to avoid coming across creepy, pushy or risk being canceled without having actual bad intentions? I will help you communicate clearly and pleasantly about intentions without you coming across as creepy or being misunderstood.
webDescription:
De afgelopen jaren komen steeds meer signalen dat mensen zich ongemakkelijk voelen door anderen. Denk aan MeToo, het schandaal rond The Voice en dat mensen tegenwoordig “gecancelled”  worden. Niemand wil natuurlijk iemand een creepy gevoel geven, maar hoe voorkom je dat eigenlijk? Wat als jij de ontvanger bent van signalen of berichten waar jij ongemakkelijk over voelt? En wat zijn signalen dat iemand zich niet zo op zijn of haar gemak voelt. Of iets liever niet of anders zou willen doen? Daarnaast, waar kun je terecht als jij hier mee zit? 

Hierover gaat mijn talk. Ik vertel je zaken die je beter niet kan doen, hoe mensen (vaak subtiel) proberen aan te geven dat ze iets niet fijn vinden. En welke rode vlaggen jij zelf kan herkennen bij anderen. Ook zal ik zeker een aantal tips geven over hoe je het wel op een prettige manier kan aangeven als je iemand interessant vindt! Want dat is juist leuk, maar wel alleen als je het op een prettige manier brengt voor de ander!! 

 

English:
These past few years several incidents have indicated that people are made uncomfortable by others. Or worse, incidents like ‘The Voice’ or ‘MeToo’. People are often canceled and charged for crimes committed. 

With cosplay nobody wants to feel bad or give a bad feeling to others. How can we communicate in a nice and respectful way with each other, without giving the person you're talking to a bad feeling? There are obvious red flags, green flags and general good practice. All of these topics and more will be part of my talk. I’ll help you with better communication and flags to watch out for so you have a more fun and safe cosplay journey.


 

TLDR;

Ik vertel je hoe je voorkomt dat je onbedoeld creepy overkomt, en hoe je je bedoelingen prettig en helder overbrengt! Welke signalen moet je op letten en hoe houd je communicatie prettig en veilig?


English:

I will help you communicate clearly and pleasantly about intentions without you coming across as creepy or being misunderstood. Let's talk about red flags and how your cosplay journey can stay a safe and fun one. 

 

Over Laurien / About

Laurien is afgestudeerd psycholoog aan de universiteit van Utrecht en geeft behandelingen als psycholoog en is daarnaast werkzaam als assistent hoofdbehandelaar.

Laurien is a university level graduated psychologist. She treats patients in a professional capacity and also works as assistant head Practitioner.
